sense.name: plain
sense.commentary: a piece of land, cleared of trees and usually enclosed
sense.examples: He planted a field of wheat. They emerged from the woods onto a vast open plain. He longed for the fields of his youth. No, Diamonds don't grow in diamond fields of South Africa. Try to land the plane in the landing field this time, Captain Bob.

sense.name: not the lab
sense.commentary: somewhere (away from a studio or office or library or laboratory) where work is done or data is collected, usually preceded by "the"
sense.examples: Anthropologists do much of their work in the field.

sense.name: discipline
sense.commentary: subject, subject area, subject field, field of study, study, branch of knowledge, line of business, sphere, domain, orbit, arena - a branch of knowledge, a commercial enterprise, or a walk of life
sense.examples: In what discipline is his doctorate? Teachers should be well trained in their subject. Anthropology is the study of human beings. They are outstanding in their field.

sense.name: battleground
sense.commentary: a region where a battle is being (or has been) fought
sense.examples: They made a tour of Civil War battlefields. The army was in the field awaiting action.

sense.name: force field
sense.commentary: The space around a radiating body within which its electromagnetic oscillations can exert force on another similar body not in contact with it
sense.examples: The magnetic field produced a force on the wire perpendicular to its current.

sense.name: playing area
sense.commentary: a piece of land prepared for playing a game
sense.examples: The home crowd cheered when Princeton took the field.

sense.name: set
sense.commentary: a set of elements such that addition and multiplication are commutative and associative and multiplication is distributive over addition and there are two elements 0 and 1
sense.examples: The set of all rational numbers is a field.

sense.name: contestants
sense.commentary: all of the competitors in a particular contest or sporting event
sense.examples: The field consisted of 7, including the Kentucky Derby winner.

sense.name: characters
sense.commentary: a set of one or more adjacent characters comprising a unit of information
sense.examples: A bit field is a field containing only binary characters.

sense.name: vision
sense.commentary: "field of view", the area that is visible (as through an optical instrument)
sense.examples: The operative field is the area that is open during surgery. Sally saw germs in the microscopic field. George heard barking nearby as the cat ran across his field of vision.
